resources.string: The word “hundred” comes from the old Norse term, “hundrath”, which actually means 120 and not 100.
In a room of 23 people there’s a 50% chance that two people have the same birthday.
symbols weren’t invented until the 20th century. Before that, equations were written in words.
The word “mathematics” only appears in one Shakespearean play, “The Taming of the Shrew”.
“Forty” is not the only number that is spelt with letters arranged in alphabetical order.
Every odd number has an “e” in it.
Diamond and graphite are both entirely made of carbon and nothing else
Markings on animal bones indicate that humans have been doing math since around 30,000BC.
Also, there are 13 letters in both “eleven plus two” and “twelve plus one”.
Zero is represented in Roman numerals.
